description: Now, you might have noticed I said "usually" when talking about interacting with the controller. This means items and fluids cannot be inputted or outputted from the controller, but information can; in the sense of statistics. Looking into the controller you will see a few things: Shape Validity, Status, Progress, Recipe Base, and Recipe Current.

The Shape Validation will let you know if the multiblock is built correctly or not. It will not tell you if you are missing or have too many hatches on the multiblock, so you need to decide that for yourself.
Status will let you know the current status of the Multiblock. If it's idle or if it's active.
Progress will show you the progress, slowly building a percent to 100%. Depending on the speed of the process, the faster the percent will rise.

Recipe Base shows the base recipe energy/steam consumption. Depending on what you're making, it uses a minimum amount of energy/steam, but it can use more to speed up the process. This doesn't happen on steam machines so I won't got too far into it now.
Recipe Current is the current amount of energy/steam being actually consumed.
